intro: Quadrella lindeniana, commonly known as the Lindena lindeniana, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, brightly colored flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth surface and a slightly waxy texture. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Quadrella lindeniana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
